document.docAuthor: Tang, Guo, Yin, Chang-Ming, Peng, Xian-Jin, Ubick, Darrell & Griswold, Charles
document.masterDocTitle: The crab spiders of the genus Lysiteles from Yunnan Province, China (Araneae: Thomisidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The crab spiders of the genus Lysiteles from Yunnan Province, China (Araneae: Thomisidae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to species of the genus
Lysiteles
from Yunnan Province

paragraph.keyLead:
5 ITA transversal digitform, embolus tube-shaped (
Fig. 19 j
)
....................................................... L. transversus
sp. nov.
7 RTA with some small denticles and some black hairs on the surface........................................................................... 8

8 Ratio of width of embolus/bulb = 0.33 , RTA with some black hairs (
Fig. 18 c
)
........................................... L. torsivus

- Ratio of width of embolus/bulb = 0.08 , RTA with some denticles (
Fig. 8 e
)
................................ L. distortus
sp. nov.

9 Ratio of width of embolus/bulb = 0.20 , RTA spatulate, cymbium without process (
Fig. 17 j
).
L. subdianicus
sp. nov.

- Ratio of width of embolus/bulb = 0.08 , RTA digitiform, cymbium with an anterior process (
Fig.
7 i
)
....... L. dianicus

14 Opisthosoma dorsum yellow with 10 pairs of small black dots (
Figs 14 a–d
)
........................................... L. punctiger

- Opisthosoma dorsum light brown with 2 pairs of joint black stripes posteriorly (
Figs 11 a–b
)
........... L. kunmingensis
- Body color dark, dorsum markings various greatly; embolus not as the aboved ..................................................... 17

- VTA without bristles, RTA curved apically, beak-shaped
.......................................................................... L. bhutanus

- Dorsal shield of prosoma gray, usually with stripes laterally (
Figs 12 a–d
)
..................................................... L. maius

21 Prosoma yellow with 1 pair of brown stripes, dorsum with some small markings (
Figs 5 a–c
); copulatory ducts rugate (
Figs 5 e, g
) ....................................................................................................................................
L. corrugus
sp. nov.

23 Ratio of length of copulatory ducts / spermatheca = 1 (
Figs 6 f, g
)
............................................... L. curvatus
sp. nov.

- Ratio of length of copulatory ducts / spermatheca = 0.5 (
Figs 12 k, l
)
............................................................. L. maius

31 Prosoma with a pair of paramedian stripes, spermathecae pyriform (
Figs. 3 c, d, l
)
.................. L. clavellatus
sp. nov.

- Prosome without markings, spermathecae global (
Figs
20 i
, j
)
............................................... L. uniprocessus
sp. nov.

33 Ratio of length of transversal slerotized plate / spermatheca = 0.8 , the shield of prosoma brown with black paramed- ian stripes or black ..................................................................................................................................................... 34

- Dorsum of opisthosoma with various black markings, spermatheca global (
Figs 13 a–d
, l)
........................... L. niger

35 Transversal slerotized plate anteriorly, much developed
............................................................................ L. bhutanus
36 Copulatory ducts slender, Ratio of width of copulatory ducts / spermatheca = 0.2 ................................................... 37
- Copulatory ducts thick, Ratio of width of copulatory ducts / spermatheca = 0.5 –1.0 ................................................ 38

- Ratio of length of copulatory ducts / spermatheca = 1.2 (
Fig 10 e
)
...................................................... L. himalayensis

39 The shield of prosoma yellow, copulatory ducts straight (
Figs 4 a–c
)
........................................... L. conflatus
sp. nov.
